panels.description: Namespaces that are up and hosting an airflow deployment. This will be 0 in single namespace mode.
panels.title: Active Namespaces

panels.description: Namespaces that are in terminating state. Most likely because a deployment has been shut down. This will be 0 in single namespace mode.
panels.title: Terminating Namespaces

panels.description: Revision count for the Scheduler. Generally the amount of times code has been pushed.
panels.title: Scheduler Generations (Deploy Count)

panels.description: Active Kubernetes Deployments. Most Airflow components are a deployment.
panels.title: Active Deployments

panels.description: Active StatefulSets for an Airflow deployment.
panels.title: Active Stateful Sets

panels.description: Total pods that are in the running state.
panels.title: Running Pods

panels.description: Percentage of Pods that have been scheduled and are currently running.
panels.title: Pods Ready

panels.description: Total containers in the Running state.
panels.title: Running Containers

panels.description: Maximum total CPU requests allowed. Each airflow deployment namespace has resource quotas applied.
panels.title: Max CPU Requests

panels.description: Maximum total CPU limits allowed. Each airflow deployment namespace has resource quotas applied.
panels.title: Max CPU Limits

panels.description: Maximum total pods allowed. Each airflow deployment namespace has resource quotas applied.
panels.title: Max Pods

panels.description: Maximum total memory requests allowed. Each airflow deployment namespace has resource quotas applied.
panels.title: Max Mem Requests

panels.description: Maximum total memory limits allowed. Each airflow deployment namespace has resource quotas applied.
panels.title: Max Mem Limits

panels.description: Percentage of total CPU requests in use currently. Each airflow deployment namespace has resource quotas applied.
panels.title: CPU Requests

panels.description: Percentage of total CPU limits in use currently. Each airflow deployment namespace has resource quotas applied.
panels.title: CPU Limits

panels.description: Percentage of total pods in use currently. Each airflow deployment namespace has resource quotas applied.

targets.expr:
sum(kube_resourcequota{resource="pods", type="used", release=~"$deployment", resourcequota=~"$deployment-resource-quota"})
/
sum(kube_resourcequota{resource="pods", type="hard", release=~"$deployment", resourcequota=~"$deployment-resource-quota"})*100

panels.title: Running Pods

panels.description: Percentage of total memory requests in use currently. Each airflow deployment namespace has resource quotas applied.
panels.title: Memory Requests

panels.description: Percentage of total memory limits in use currently. Each airflow deployment namespace has resource quotas applied.
panels.title: Memory Limits

panels.description: Status of Airflow deployments. Healthy if everything is up and running, and Unhealthy if there is a problem or during code pushes.
panels.title: Deployment Status

panels.description: Status of containers that make up an airflow deployment. A failing status here will make the deployment above show Unhealthy.
panels.title: Container Status
